text: Any ideas on the prospects of running Julia on the new Apple M1 GPU and neural engine? I couldn't find this discussed anywhere.

elements.text: Any ideas on the prospects of running Julia on the new Apple M1 GPU and neural engine? I couldn't find this discussed anywhere.

text: There have been a few on and off threads, but they were all swallowed up by the :slack: :hole:. Last I recall at least one person was interested in wrapping the relevant compute APIs for CPU/GPU, but I'm not sure if that ever materialized.

elements.text: There have been a few on and off threads, but they were all swallowed up by the
. Last I recall at least one person was interested in wrapping the relevant compute APIs for CPU/GPU, but I'm not sure if that ever materialized.

text: <https://github.com/geohot/tinygrad/tree/master/ane> was also posted for trying to make sense of and operate the neural engine. That one is likely a much harder target, given a) how obtuse the API is (repo is pretty much reverse engineering) and b) how limited the ANE functionality appears to be.

elements.text: was also posted for trying to make sense of and operate the neural engine. That one is likely a much harder target, given a) how obtuse the API is (repo is pretty much reverse engineering) and b) how limited the ANE functionality appears to be.

text: Ya I just wondered if any of the existing work on AMDGPU would be helpful there but I suppose not.

elements.text: Ya I just wondered if any of the existing work on AMDGPU would be helpful there but I suppose not.

text: No, it will not because (AFAICT) Apple does not allow you to submit binaries with native GCN in them. So AMDGPU.jl has nothing useful to do.

elements.text: No, it will not because (AFAICT) Apple does not allow you to submit binaries with native GCN in them. So AMDGPU.jl has nothing useful to do.

text: Someone needs to investigate if we can provide Metal with binaries containing either LLVM IR, SPIR-V IR, or native instructions, and provide a demo of doing that with such IR/code generated with GPUCompiler.jl

elements.text: Someone needs to investigate if we can provide Metal with binaries containing either LLVM IR, SPIR-V IR, or native instructions, and provide a demo of doing that with such IR/code generated with GPUCompiler.jl

text: My investigations were saying you indeed can

elements.text: My investigations were saying you indeed can

text: But spirV-cross at the time did not support metal compute. Don’t know if that has been addressed

elements.text: But spirV-cross at the time did not support metal compute. Don’t know if that has been addressed

text: <https://github.com/KhronosGroup/SPIRV-Cross/issues/984> -- that's still open, so looks like it still isn't possible

elements.text: -- that's still open, so looks like it still isn't possible
